column4: I'm trying to install Hardy, but both the Live and Alternate install CDs aren't picking up my current partition table. I have 2 SATA hard drives, one 400GB with a single ntfs partition, and the other with 4 partitions (ntfs, ext3, swap, ntfs) and it won't pick up the other drive
ntfs is not natively supported by Ubuntu
I'm not trying to install to NTFS, I'm trying to install to that first ext3 partition
fde, I don't need NTFS at all, it's my second hard drive's partition table I'm having issues with (I just need to install over an existing ext3 partition
